txt.en: 'F12' will hide all User Interface elements.
'Ctrl' + 'F1' through 'F6' will show and hide individual inventory bags.
'Ctrl' + 'O' will bring up the Options panel.
Use the HELP option on the System menu to access FAQs, request support, or file a bug (F7).
Use the 'Tab' key to cycle through nearby targets.
Is the User Interface too small? Too big? Change its scale in the UI Settings tab of the Options Panel (Ctrl-O).
Use 'Alt+F10' to toggle your lantern while outside at night.
Quests that are recommended for a Fellowship are indicated in your journal with a group icon.
At Level 15, you can buy your own house! Visit a Housing Broker near Michel Delving, South of Bree, Duillond, Thorin's Halls, or at Bree's Boar Fountain.
When your Kinship reaches Lifespan Rank 7, your Leader can purchase a special Kinship House.
When you own a home you can decorate it, purchase extra storage, and invite your friends to come and visit.
Owning a house in a Neighbourhood gives you a discount to the vendors there. Remember to buy local!
Want to let your friends into your house? You can manage Permissions from the House tab of the Character Journal.
Don't forget to maintain your house. Pay upkeep by the week or a couple in advance from the House panel.
You can open the House Management UI from the Character panel (C). Use it to pay upkeep.
You can toggle floating player, NPC, and item names by pressing the 'N' key.
You can change all tooltips to be mouse relative by modifying your Options (Ctrl-O).
You can disable involuntary emotes in the Options panel (Ctrl-O).
Want to create and choose an outfit? Use the inventory and outfit buttons on Cosmetic Outfits tab on the Character panel (C).
Tired of getting tutorial pop-ups? You can toggle them off in the Options Panel (Ctrl-O).
Want to customize your appearance? Use the show/hide toggles next to the equipment slots on the Character tab (C).
You can toggle off visual notification for combat responses as an option in the Options Panel (Ctrl-O).
Skirmishes, an instance type unlockable at Level 20, scale to your level and group size.
Ctrl-J opens your Instance Finder panel and allows you to join dungeon instances and Skirmishes from anywhere in the world.
Marks, Medallions and Seals can be used to purchase gear and traits at a Skirmish Camp.
Deeds that are advanced by using offensive skills do not advance when used on trivial difficulty (grey) monsters.
Keep up with the latest in Middle-earth fashion. You can use the outfit system to customize your look.
When you 'Equip' an item to an outfit system slot, you don't need to keep the item equipped to keep its appearance!
You can bind a key to an outfit allowing you to switch cosmetic outfits instantly.
Click on the ring next to a quest in the quest tracker to quickly bring up that quest in your quest journal.
Right-click on the ring next to a quest in the quest tracker to bring up quest tracker options. Find quests near your current location or select a quest for quest guide guidance.
Right-click on a ring in the quest tracker and pick 'Find Others On Quest' to help find people working on that quest.
You can use 'Ctrl' + 'right-click' on almost any item icon in the game to create an examination link for the chat window.
You can preview dye colours on clothing in the Dressing Room UI.
Complete Class Deeds to earn Class Trait Points!
In order to craft an item, you must have the right tool, the proper ingredients, and be near the appropriate crafting facility.
Press 'X' to toggle Target Lock-on Mode for your camera.
Type '/stuck' + 'Enter' or '/unstuck' + 'Enter' to free your character from a stuck location.
Visit the forums at www.lotro.com to keep up on the latest news updates, game information, and community discussions.
You can examine inventory items, other players, enemies, and NPCs by holding your cursor over the target.
Hold down the left mouse-button to use your mouse to control the direction the camera faces, even while you are moving.
After earning a new level, be sure to check for new abilities or Trait Points (K) (J).
Left-click on another player, NPC, or enemy to see its name and vital statistics.
There are many exclusive items available from the LOTRO Store.
Any player or fellowship to engage a monster will get credit for defeating it.
Check the LOTRO Store for weekly sales on specific items.
Mounts are purchaseable skills that allow you to summon a unique mount for your characters.
You can automatically hide the crafting panel when creating new items if you toggle the option on the crafting panel.
Many crafting recipes permit you to create different versions of an item from the same recipe.
Visit Lalia's Market near the Boar Fountain in Bree to purchase select cosmetic clothing items and sets.
You can purchase the Riding Trait from the LOTRO Store or Mithril vendors.
Press 'Shift' + 'C' to bring up the Collections Panel. See what Mounts, Cosmetic Pets, and Emotes you have and have yet to collect!
When selling items to a vendor, only unequipped items will be shown in the 'Sell' window.
The Deed seal will change from grey to red in your Deed Log when the Deed has been completed.
You may own a standard house and also any number of premium houses. Each Kinship, however, may only have a single Kinship house.
Talk to a housing broker at Bree's Boar Fountain, in Dol Amroth, or in Minas Tirith to visit a premium housing neighbourhood on the Cape of Belfalas in Gondor.
'Ctrl' + '\' will allow you to move your vitals and other user interfaces on the screen.
Lockboxes contain gear, cosmetics, and other useful items. Get keys from the LOTRO Store to open them.
Press 'Enter' or '/' to type in the chat window.
The default movement mode is running. Press 'Insert' to toggle between running and walking modes.
To attack a targeted enemy, right-click it, double-click it, press '`', or use any damaging attack skill.
Vault-keepers grant access to your bank, where you can store up to 30 items. Additional storage space can also be purchased.
Visit the Quest Grouping tab on the Social Panel (O) to find other players who want to group up for a specific quest.
You can modify the volume of player generated music in the Option Panel (Ctrl-O).
The Quests/Deeds Tracker allows you to display the current objectives of up to five quests or deeds at any given time.
Press 'T' to display the Crafting Panel, where you can view all the details related to creating your own items.
Press 'O' to display the Social Panel, which shows information about your current Fellowship, Kinship, and Friends list.
Press 'Shift + L' to display the Deed Log, where you can view completed deeds and the rewards that you can receive.
Press the 'Num Lock' key to toggle autorun ON or OFF.
In most instances, you will find an option to leave an Instance by right clicking on your portrait.
Press the 'Backspace' key to select the nearest target.

Key Mapping in the Options panel will allow you to reset default key mappings and bind common actions to your favorite key. Dismount / Remount, select next item, follow selection, and the /music system notes are some favourites.
'Ctrl + left-click' any item in inventory, on a vendor, or linked in chat to try it on in the Dressing Room.
Use 'Del' to select the nearest item, and 'U' to use it.
You can change the hover-over delay until a tooltip appears in the Options Menu (Ctrl-O).
'J' will open the Trait Tree Panel, where you can choose your class path and allocate trait points for powers, bonuses, and skills.
Avoidances increase your chances of avoiding attacks.
Mitigations reduce the amount of damage you take from specific damage-types.
You can improve the skills and strengths of your Skirmish Soldier by purchasing new Traits and Skills at the Skirmish Trainer.
Your characters have access to a shared storage vault that allows them to share inventory items.
Additional Shared Storage slots can be unlocked on the LOTRO Store.
Your characters have access to a Wardrobe that allows them to cosmetically share clothing and armour.
98 Additional Wardrobe slots can be unlocked from the LOTRO Store.
Many instances are scalable to your level and include unique rewards at different tiers (CTRL-J).
In the Options panel you can enable a directional selection arrow to guide you to your selection (Ctrl-O).
You can control the visibility and display density of frills (grasses, flowers, reeds) in the Options panel.
You can disable rain or snow by toggling precipitation effects in the Options panel.
You can change the action for each of the toolbar buttons on your main bar in the Options panel.
Toggle 'Always accept automatic quests' in the UI Settings of the Options panel to accept all offered remotely bestowed quests.
You can enable movement assistance in combat to move you to your skill's target in the Options panel.
In the Options panel you can toggle 'move to use' to determine whether you move toward your selection when you try to use it.
Right-click your character portrait display to select a custom frame, toggle various UI panels, or engage with the music system if you have an instrument equipped.
The search field in many panels (skills, options, quest log, deed log, titles) will reduce the displayed items to only those matching your search.
The 'H' key will pin the tooltip you are currently viewing. You can pin multiple tooltips at once, which can be useful for tracking and quickly selecting foes or friends.
